steering.description: A global professional services company specializing in IT consulting strategy and digital transformation.

representatives.title: Managing Director and Chief Technologist - Technology Sustainability Innovation

steering.name: Google
steering.description: A global technology company specializing in search engines, cloud computing, AI.

steering.description: A multinational IT service provider offering consulting, digital solutions and managed services.

steering.description: A worldwide technology enterprise focused on automation, electrification and digitalization.

representatives.name: Aurelie Bourgeais
representatives.title: IB & NCL Tech Chief of Staff

projects.name: Awesome Green Software
projects.description: A database of research, tools, code, libraries and training for building applications that emit less carbon into our atmosphere.

projects.name: Carbon Aware SDK
projects.description: An SDK to enable the creation of carbon aware applications, that do more when the electricity comes from clean low-carbon sources and less when it does not.

projects.name: Carbon Measurement Engine (Carmen)
projects.description: Implement the SCI at scale to measure the carbon footprint of cloud-based software at both infrastructure and application levels. Delivers the visibility organisations need to understand and act on their software emissions.

projects.name: Green AI Practitioner Course
projects.description: AI has an environmental cost. This course puts the levers in your hands.

projects.name: Green Software Patterns
projects.description: A database of software patterns that, if applied, will reduce software emissions.

projects.name: Green Software Practitioner
projects.description: Learn the basic concepts a software practitioner needs to know to build, maintain and run greener applications.

projects.name: Impact Framework
projects.description: A framework to Model, Measure, siMulate and Monitor the environmental impacts of software. Allows impact calculations without coding - users create a manifest file and the framework processes it.

leads.name: Navveen Balani
leads.title: Managing Director and Chief Technologist - Technology Sustainability Innovation

projects.name: Policy Radar
projects.description: Calendar of anticipated policy events, including consultations, proposed legislation, and enacted laws relevant to GSF member regions.

projects.name: Real Time Energy and Carbon Standard for Cloud Providers (RTC)
projects.description: Establish a benchmark for measuring carbon emissions.

projects.name: Software Carbon Intensity (SCI)
projects.description: A specification that describes how to calculate a carbon intensity for software applications. Defines methodology for computing total carbon emissions and converting them into rates that drive real-world emissions reductions.

leads.name: Navveen Balani
leads.title: Managing Director and Chief Technologist - Technology Sustainability Innovation

projects.meeting_schedule: Every 2 weeks on Thursday at 16:00 GMT

projects.name: Software Carbon Intensity for Artificial Intelligence (SCI for AI)
projects.description: Extending the SCI to AI and addressing challenges of measuring artificial intelligence carbon emissions. Assists AI practitioners in understanding and reducing the carbon footprint of AI systems across the lifecycle.

leads.name: Navveen Balani
leads.title: Managing Director and Chief Technologist - Technology Sustainability Innovation

projects.name: Software Carbon Intensity for Web (SCI for Web)
projects.description: Extending the SCI to the Web and addressing challenges of measuring website carbon emissions.

projects.name: Software Carbon Intensity Guide
projects.description: Understanding methodologies for calculating SCI components including energy, carbon intensity, embodied emissions and functional unit values.

projects.name: Software Energy Efficiency (SEE)
projects.description: Methodology for calculating the energy consumption rate of a software system.

projects.name: Sustainable Organisational Framework for Technology (SOFT)
projects.description: A framework for decision-making during technology development, implementation, and operation by incorporating available methodologies. Assists technology leaders in adopting software applications while reducing carbon emissions through decision trees, templates, and metrics.

projects.name: Workload Dynamic Power and Cooling (WDPC)
projects.description: Standardized data coordination between computational workloads and energy infrastructure. Defines a framework enabling reliable, consistent signalling between workloads, data centres, and grid operators.

working_groups.name: Software Standards Working Group
working_groups.description: Develops baseline specifications for Green Software and ensures interoperable implementation across computing platforms in both developed and developing regions.

chairs.name: Navveen Balani
chairs.title: Managing Director and Chief Technologist - Technology Sustainability Innovation

projects: Real Time Energy and Carbon Standard for Cloud Providers (RTC)
Software Carbon Intensity for Artificial Intelligence (SCI for AI)
Software Carbon Intensity for Web (SCI for Web)

working_groups.name: Hardware Standards Working Group
working_groups.description: Develops standardized terminology, design/build/re-use and recycle standards, measurement methodologies, and reporting frameworks for efficient and sustainable physical hardware and related supporting infrastructure.

working_groups.name: Policy Working Group
working_groups.description: A nonpartisan convening body that translates technical expertise in sustainable software into actionable policy insights. Engages external bodies on green software policy matters, creates proposals, and manages product/service certification projects.

committees.name: Steering Committee
committees.description: The primary governing body of the Green Software Foundation, with participants selected by Steering Member Organizations. Provides strategic definition and oversight; regulatory compliance and monitoring; maintenance of relationships and organizational identity; decisions on the OKRs of the Foundation; approval of the Foundation's Budget; and approval of changes to the Foundation's Charter.

committees.name: Developer Relations Committee
committees.description: Focuses on driving adoption of green software standards and best practices across the global developer ecosystem. Oversees education initiatives and supports community outreach programs including Champions and Meetup programs.

members.name: Julien Nioche
members.title: Open Source Contributor and Green Software Advocate

committees.name: Green AI Committee
committees.description: Shapes the GSF's strategy in building knowledge, standards, and tooling to ensure AI development results in the least amount of environmental harm possible to support net zero ambitions. Scope focuses on reducing AI's environmental impact, excluding AI for sustainability or AI safety discussions.

members.name: Chris Xie
members.title: Head of Open Source Program Office, Senior Director, Strategy & Business Development

cross_reference_insights.most_active_person: Navveen Balani (Accenture) appears across 6+ roles: Steering Committee, Green AI Committee, Software Standards WG Co-Chair, and leads 3 projects (SCI, SCI for AI, Impact Framework). He is by far the most connected individual in the foundation.
multi_role_leaders: Navveen Balani - 6 roles across steering, committees, WGs, and projects
Gadhu Sundaram - Steering Committee Chair + Green AI Committee
Jonathan Turnbull - Steering Committee Vice-Chair + Green AI Committee
Vinjosh Varghese - Steering Committee + Green AI Committee + Developer Relations
Henry Richardson - Software Standards WG Co-Chair + leads SCI + SCI for AI
Christopher Liljenstolpe - Steering Committee + Hardware Standards WG Chair
Sanjay Podder - Steering Committee + Green AI Committee
cross_reference_insights.accenture_dominance: Accenture has the broadest representation with 3 people (Navveen Balani, Sanjay Podder, Hannah Unkefer), and Navveen Balani alone leads or co-chairs 3 projects and 1 working group. This gives Accenture outsized influence across the foundation.
cross_reference_insights.microsoft_project_influence: Microsoft is a General member (not Steering) but leads the Carbon Aware SDK (Vaughan Knight) and co-leads Impact Framework (Srinivasan Rakhunathan). They also have Simon Thurman on the Developer Relations Committee.

potential_content_gaps: Green Software Patterns is listed under 'Community Working Group' but that WG has no directory page (404) - it may have been retired or merged
SCI Self Certification Program has no description - appears to be very early stage
Green AI Practitioner Course is only at Pre-proposal stage with no leads listed
Policy Radar has no named project leads on its detail page
Awesome Green Software and Green Software Practitioner detail pages were not fetched but they are Published projects that likely have rich content
Carmen was donated by Amadeus and launched Jan 2026 - the newest project
WDPC launched May 2025 - second newest, only project in the Hardware Standards WG
membership_patterns: 6 Steering members vs 64 General members (roughly 1:10 ratio)
Cisco is the newest Steering member (Feb 2025), bringing hardware/data centre expertise
Strong academic presence: 12+ universities/research institutions as General members
Notable tech companies as General (not Steering): Microsoft, IBM, GitHub, GitLab, Goldman Sachs, Shell, Mastercard, Schneider Electric
Microsoft is notably General despite having project leads - suggests influence through contribution rather than governance
Government representation: GovTech Singapore, Metropolitan Police, NREL
Geographic diversity: members from Japan (NTT DATA, NRI), Singapore, India, Spain, Italy, Sweden, Ireland, UK, Germany, USA, France
notes.governance_structure: Three-tier: Steering Committee (governance) -> Working Groups (standards development) + Committees (operations/outreach) -> Projects (deliverables). Each Steering member gets seats on the Steering Committee. Working Groups and Committees operate by consensus with 75% supermajority fallback.
